page.title: 01DIGSWELL WELWYN GARDEN CITY
page.content: This is essentially a mixture of New Town and villages set in arable landscape diagonally bisected by a chalk_fed stream, used as a boundary between the New Town and the Green Belt. The valley is designated as a beauty area in which development is prohibited. The limiting of the growth of the villages to their existing boundaries and the ease of access to the main line railway to Central London for commuters makes this area expensive to live in. Industry, by design, is grouped in an area close to the railway. It consists of high technology firms, based on research and clean products. Leisure facilities are grouped along the river to reinforce the distinction between the New Town and the Green Belt.
